alert.note: Alert for Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 12:53AM PST until December 07 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. .Heavy rain will continue in the North Washington Cascades into this afternoon. For the North West Region...including Concrete, Mt. Vernon...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skagit River near Concrete. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 37.0 feet, the Skagit River will cause major flooding from Rockport downstream through Sedro Woolley. Deep and swift flood waters will inundate many roads...farms...and some business and residential areas especially Cape Horn...Hamilton...and Thunderbird. Cockreham Island...the Nookachamps area and the Sterling area will be inundated. Levees east of Sedro Woolley may be damaged. This level for this location on the Skagit corresponds to a Phase 1 flood in the Skagit County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 38.7 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 900 AM PST.
